latency-histogram.p99th: 99th - The 99th percentile represents a value where 99 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 1 percent of values are above, the 99th percentile value.
latency-histogram.p90th: 90th - The 90th percentile represents a value where 90 percent of values during a time interval are at or below, and 10 percent of values are above, the 90th percentile value.
latency-histogram.median: Median - The median, also known as the 50th percentile, represents a value where 50 percent of values during a time interval are either at or below the median value.
latency-histogram.max: Max - The maximum latency during a time interval.
latency-histogram.min: Min - The minimum latency during a time interval.

aggregates.max: Max - The maximum value recorded during a time interval. A higher maximum value could have occurred without it being recorded.
aggregates.average: Avg - The average of values recorded during a time interval.
aggregates.min: Min - The minimal value recorded during a time interval. A lower minimal value could have occurred without it being recorded.
aggregates.total: Total - Sum of the values recorded for each node during a time interval.

write-ops.label: Write Requests
write-ops.description: The number of write requests per second on the coordinator nodes, analogous to client writes. Monitoring the number of requests over a given time period reveals system write workload and usage patterns.

write-latency-op.label: Write Request Latency
write-latency-op.description: The average response times (in milliseconds) of a client write. The time period starts when a node receives a client write request, and ends when the node responds back to the client. Depending on consistency level and replication factor, this may include the network latency from writing to the replicas.

write-histogram.label: Write Latency (Stacked)
write-histogram.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a client writes. The time period starts when a node receives a client write request, and ends when the node responds back to the client. Depending on consistency level and replication factor, this may include the network latency from writing to the replicas.

read-ops.label: Read Requests
read-ops.description: The number of read requests per second on the coordinator nodes, analogous to client reads. Monitoring the number of requests over a given time period reveals system read workload and usage patterns.

read-latency-op.label: Read Request Latency
read-latency-op.description: The average response times (in milliseconds) of a client read. The time period starts when a node receives a client read request, and ends when the node responds back to the client. Depending on consistency level and replication factor, this may include the network latency from requesting the data’s replicas.

read-histogram.label: Read Latency (Stacked)
read-histogram.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentiles of a client reads. The time period starts when a node receives a client read request, and ends when the node responds back to the client. Depending on consistency level and replication factor, this may include the network latency from requesting the data’s replicas.

nonheap-committed.label: Non Heap Committed
nonheap-committed.description: Allocated memory, guaranteed for Java nonheap.

nonheap-max.label: Non Heap Max
nonheap-max.description: Maximum amount that the Java nonheap can grow.

nonheap-used.label: Non Heap Used
nonheap-used.description: Average amount of Java nonheap memory used.

heap-committed.label: Heap Committed
heap-committed.description: Allocated memory guaranteed for the Java heap.

heap-max.label: Heap Max
heap-max.description: Maximum amount that the Java heap can grow.

heap-used.label: Heap Used
heap-used.description: Average amount of Java heap memory used.

cms-collection-count.label: JVM CMS Collection Count
cms-collection-count.description: Number of concurrent mark sweep garbage collections performed per second.

par-new-collection-count.label: JVM ParNew Collection Count
par-new-collection-count.description: Number of ParNew garbage collections performed per second. ParNew collections pause all work in the JVM but should finish quickly.

cms-collection-time.label: JVM CMS Collection Time
cms-collection-time.description: Average number of milliseconds spent performing CMS garbage collections per second.

par-new-collection-time.label: JVM ParNew Collection Time
par-new-collection-time.description: Average number of milliseconds spent performing ParNew garbage collections per second. ParNew collections pause all work in the JVM but should finish quickly.

data-load.label: Data Size
data-load.description: The live disk space used by all tables on a node.

total-bytes-compacted.label: Total Bytes Compacted
total-bytes-compacted.description: Number of bytes compacted per second.

total-compactions-completed.label: Total Compactions
total-compactions-completed.description: Number of compaction tasks completed per second.

pending-compaction-tasks.label: Compactions Pending
pending-compaction-tasks.description: Estimated number of compactions required to achieve the desired state. This includes the pending queue to the compaction executor and additional tasks that may be created from their completion.

pending-flushes.label: Flushes Pending
pending-flushes.description: Number of memtables queued for the flush process. A flush sorts and writes the memtables to disk, which could block writes.

pending-gossip-stage.label: Gossip Tasks Pending
pending-gossip-stage.description: Number of gossip messages and acknowledgments queued and waiting to be sent or received.

pending-hinted-handoff.label: Hinted Handoff Pending
pending-hinted-handoff.description: Number of hints in the queue waiting to be delivered after a failed node comes up.

pending-internal-response-stage.label: Internal Responses Pending
pending-internal-response-stage.description: Number of pending tasks from internal tasks, such as nodes joining and leaving the cluster.

pending-anti-entropy-stage.label: Manual Repair Tasks Pending
pending-anti-entropy-stage.description: Repair tasks pending, such as handling the merkle tree transfer after the validation compaction.

pending-memtable-post-flush.label: Memtable Post Flushers Pending
pending-memtable-post-flush.description: Number of pending tasks related to the last step in flushing memtables to disk as SSTables. Includes removing unnecessary commitlog files and committing Solr-based secondary indexes.

pending-migration-stage.label: Migrations Pending
pending-migration-stage.description: Number of pending tasks from system methods that modified the schema.

pending-misc-stage.label: Misc. Tasks Pending
pending-misc-stage.description: Number of pending tasks from infrequently run operations, such as taking a snapshot or processing the notification of a completed replication.

pending-read-stage.label: Read Requests Pending
pending-read-stage.description: Number of pending read requests. Read requests read data off of disk and deserialize cached data.

pending-read-repair-stage.label: Read Repair Tasks Pending
pending-read-repair-stage.description: Number of read repair operations in the queue waiting to run.

pending-repl-on-write-tasks.label: Repl. on Write Tasks Pending
pending-repl-on-write-tasks.description: Number of pending counter increment tasks that will read then write on the replicas after a coordinator's local write. Depending on consistency level used on writes, tasks may back up outside of the normal write path.

pending-request-response-stage.label: Request Responses Pending
pending-request-response-stage.description: Number of pending callbacks to execute after a task on a remote node completes.

pending-mutation-stage.label: Write Requests Pending
pending-mutation-stage.description: Number of write requests received by the cluster and waiting to be handled.

pending-counter-mutation-stage.label: Counter Mutations Pending
pending-counter-mutation-stage.description: Number of counter mutation requests received by the cluster and waiting to be handled.

pending-memory-meter.label: Memory Meter Pending
pending-memory-meter.description: Pending tasks that will calculate the live ratio which is used to estimate memtable size. The live ratio is the actual memory usage of a memtable including JVM overhead as it compares it to the raw data size. There will be at most one pending task per table.

pending-validation-executor.label: Validation Executor Pending
pending-validation-executor.description: Pending task to read data from sstables and generate a merkle tree for a repair.

pending-compaction-executor.label: Compaction Executor Pending
pending-compaction-executor.description: Pending compactions that are known. This may deviate from "pending compactions" which includes an estimate of tasks that these pending tasks may create after completion.

pending-pending-range-calculator.label: Pending Range Calculator Pending
pending-pending-range-calculator.description: Pending tasks to calculate the ranges according to bootsrapping and leaving nodes.

active-flushes.label: Flushes Active
active-flushes.description: Number of memtables being flushed flush process. A flush sorts and writes the memtables to disk, which could block writes.

active-gossip-stage.label: Gossip Tasks Active
active-gossip-stage.description: Number of gossip messages and acknowledgments actively being sent or received.

active-hinted-handoff.label: Hinted Handoff Active
active-hinted-handoff.description: Number of hints actively being delivered after a failed node comes up.

active-internal-response-stage.label: Internal Responses Active
active-internal-response-stage.description: Number of active tasks from internal tasks, such as nodes joining and leaving the cluster.

active-anti-entropy-stage.label: Manual Repair Tasks Active
active-anti-entropy-stage.description: Repair tasks active, such as handling the merkle tree transfer after the validation compaction.

active-memtable-post-flush.label: Memtable Post Flushers Active
active-memtable-post-flush.description: Number of active tasks related to the last step in flushing memtables to disk as SSTables. Includes removing unnecessary commitlog files and committing Solr-based secondary indexes.

active-migration-stage.label: Migrations Active
active-migration-stage.description: Number of active tasks from system methods that modified the schema.

active-misc-stage.label: Misc. Tasks Active
active-misc-stage.description: Number of active tasks from infrequently run operations, such as taking a snapshot or processing the notification of a completed replication.

active-read-stage.label: Read Requests Active
active-read-stage.description: Number of active read requests. Read requests read data off of disk and deserialize cached data.

active-read-repair-stage.label: Read Repair Tasks Active
active-read-repair-stage.description: Number of read repair operations actively being run.

active-repl-on-write-tasks.label: Repl. on Write Tasks Active
active-repl-on-write-tasks.description: Number of active counter increment tasks that will read then write on the replicas after a coordinator's local write. Depending on consistency level used on writes, tasks may back up outside of the normal write path.

active-request-response-stage.label: Request Responses Active
active-request-response-stage.description: Number of callbacks to being executed after a task on a remote node is completed.

active-mutation-stage.label: Write Requests Active
active-mutation-stage.description: Number of write requests received by the cluster and being handled.

active-counter-mutation-stage.label: Counter Mutations Active
active-counter-mutation-stage.description: Number of counter mutation requests received by the cluster and being handled.

active-memory-meter.label: Memory Meter Active
active-memory-meter.description: Active tasks that calculate the live ratio which is used to estimate memtable size. The live ratio is the actual memory usage of a memtable including JVM overhead as it compares it to the raw data size. There will be at most one pending task per table.

active-validation-executor.label: Validation Executor Active
active-validation-executor.description: Active task to read data from sstables and generate a merkle tree for a repair.

active-pending-range-calculator.label: Pending Range Calculator Active
active-pending-range-calculator.description: Active tasks to calculate the ranges according to bootsrapping and leaving nodes.

completed-flushes.label: Flushes Completed
completed-flushes.description: Number of memtables recently flushed. A flush sorts and writes the memtables to disk, which could block writes.

completed-gossip-stage.label: Gossip Tasks Completed
completed-gossip-stage.description: Number of gossip messages and acknowledgments recently sent or received.

completed-hinted-handoff.label: Hinted Handoff Completed
completed-hinted-handoff.description: Number of hints recently delivered after a failed node comes up.

completed-internal-response-stage.label: Internal Responses Completed
completed-internal-response-stage.description: Number of recently completed tasks from internal tasks, such as nodes joining and leaving the cluster.

completed-anti-entropy-stage.label: Manual Repair Tasks Completed
completed-anti-entropy-stage.description: Repair tasks recently completed, such as handling the merkle tree transfer after the validation compaction.

completed-memtable-post-flush.label: Memtable Post Flushers Completed
completed-memtable-post-flush.description: Number of completed tasks related to the last step in flushing memtables to disk as SSTables. Includes removing unnecessary commitlog files and committing Solr-based secondary indexes.

completed-migration-stage.label: Migrations Completed
completed-migration-stage.description: Number of completed tasks from system methods that modified the schema.

completed-misc-stage.label: Misc. Tasks Completed
completed-misc-stage.description: Number of completed tasks from infrequently run operations, such as taking a snapshot or processing the notification of a completed replication.

completed-read-stage.label: Read Requests Completed
completed-read-stage.description: Number of completed read requests. Read requests read data off of disk and deserialize cached data.

completed-read-repair-stage.label: Read Repair Tasks Completed
completed-read-repair-stage.description: Number of read repair operations recently completed.

completed-repl-on-write-tasks.label: Repl. on Write Tasks Completed
completed-repl-on-write-tasks.description: Number of completed counter increment tasks that read then write on the replicas after a coordinator's local write. Depending on consistency level used on writes, tasks may back up outside of the normal write path.

completed-request-response-stage.label: Request Responses Completed
completed-request-response-stage.description: Number of completed callbacks executed after a task on a remote node is completed.

completed-mutation-stage.label: Write Requests Completed
completed-mutation-stage.description: Number of write requests received by the cluster that have been handled.

completed-counter-mutation-stage.label: Counter Mutation Requests Completed
completed-counter-mutation-stage.description: Number of counter mutation requests received by the cluster that have been handled.

completed-memory-meter.label: Memory Meter Completed
completed-memory-meter.description: Completed tasks that calculate the live ratio which is used to estimate memtable size. The live ratio is the actual memory usage of a memtable including JVM overhead as it compares it to the raw data size. There will be at most one pending task per table.

completed-validation-executor.label: Validation Executor Completed
completed-validation-executor.description: Completed tasks to read data from sstables and generate a merkle tree for a repair.

completed-pending-range-calculator.label: Pending Range Calculator Completed
completed-pending-range-calculator.description: Completed tasks to calculate the ranges according to bootsrapping and leaving nodes.

blocked-flushes.label: Flushes Blocked
blocked-flushes.description: Number of memtables flush process blocked. A flush sorts and writes the memtables to disk, which could block writes.

blocked-gossip-stage.label: Gossip Tasks Blocked
blocked-gossip-stage.description: Number of gossip messages and acknowledgments blocked waiting to be sent or received.

blocked-hinted-handoff.label: Hinted Handoff Blocked
blocked-hinted-handoff.description: Number of hints blocked waiting to be delivered after a failed node comes up.

blocked-internal-response-stage.label: Internal Responses Blocked
blocked-internal-response-stage.description: Number of blocked tasks from internal tasks, such as nodes joining and leaving the cluster.

blocked-anti-entropy-stage.label: Manual Repair Tasks Blocked
blocked-anti-entropy-stage.description: Repair tasks blocked, such as handling the merkle tree transfer after the validation compaction.

blocked-memtable-post-flush.label: Memtable Post Flushers Blocked
blocked-memtable-post-flush.description: Number of blocked tasks related to the last step in flushing memtables to disk as SSTables. Includes removing unnecessary commitlog files and committing Solr-based secondary indexes.

blocked-migration-stage.label: Migrations Blocked
blocked-migration-stage.description: Number of blocked tasks from system methods that modified the schema.

blocked-misc-stage.label: Misc. Tasks Blocked
blocked-misc-stage.description: Number of blocked tasks from infrequently run operations, such as taking a snapshot or processing the notification of a completed replication.

blocked-read-stage.label: Read Requests Blocked
blocked-read-stage.description: Number of blocked read requests. Read requests read data off of disk and deserialize cached data.

blocked-read-repair-stage.label: Read Repair Tasks Blocked
blocked-read-repair-stage.description: Number of read repair operations blocked waiting to run.

blocked-repl-on-write-tasks.label: Repl. on Write Tasks Blocked
blocked-repl-on-write-tasks.description: Number of blocked counter increment tasks that will read then write on the replicas after a coordinator's local write. Depending on consistency level used on writes, tasks may back up outside of the normal write path.

blocked-request-response-stage.label: Request Responses Blocked
blocked-request-response-stage.description: Number of blocked callbacks to be executed after a task on a remote node is completed.

blocked-mutation-stage.label: Write Requests Blocked
blocked-mutation-stage.description: Number of write requests received by the cluster and blocked waiting to be handled.

blocked-counter-mutation-stage.label: Counter Mutation Requests Blocked
blocked-counter-mutation-stage.description: Number of counter mutation requests received by the cluster that are blocked and waiting to be handled.

total-blocked-flushes.label: Total Flushes Blocked
total-blocked-flushes.description: Total number of memtables flush process blocked. A flush sorts and writes the memtables to disk, which could block writes.

total-blocked-gossip-stage.label: Total Gossip Tasks Blocked
total-blocked-gossip-stage.description: Total number of gossip messages and acknowledgments blocked waiting to be sent or received.

total-blocked-hinted-handoff.label: Total Hinted Handoff Blocked
total-blocked-hinted-handoff.description: Total number of hints blocked waiting to be delivered after a failed node comes up.

total-blocked-internal-response-stage.label: Total Internal Responses Blocked
total-blocked-internal-response-stage.description: Total number of blocked tasks from internal tasks, such as nodes joining and leaving the cluster.

total-blocked-anti-entropy-stage.label: Total Manual Repair Tasks Blocked
total-blocked-anti-entropy-stage.description: Total repair tasks blocked, such as handling the merkle tree transfer after the validation compaction.

total-blocked-memtable-post-flush.label: Total Memtable Post Flushers Blocked
total-blocked-memtable-post-flush.description: Total number of blocked tasks related to the last step in flushing memtables to disk as SSTables. Includes removing unnecessary commitlog files and committing Solr-based secondary indexes.

total-blocked-migration-stage.label: Total Migrations Blocked
total-blocked-migration-stage.description: Total number of blocked tasks from system methods that modified the schema.

total-blocked-misc-stage.label: Total Misc. Tasks Blocked
total-blocked-misc-stage.description: Total number of blocked tasks from infrequently run operations, such as taking a snapshot or processing the notification of a completed replication.

total-blocked-read-stage.label: Total Read Requests Blocked
total-blocked-read-stage.description: Total number of blocked read requests. Read requests read data off of disk and deserialize cached data.

total-blocked-read-repair-stage.label: Total Read Repair Tasks Blocked
total-blocked-read-repair-stage.description: Total number of read repair operations blocked waiting to run.

total-blocked-repl-on-write-tasks.label: Total Repl. on Write Tasks Blocked
total-blocked-repl-on-write-tasks.description: Total number of blocked counter increment tasks that will read then write on the replicas after a coordinator's local write. Depending on consistency level used on writes, tasks may back up outside of the normal write path.

total-blocked-request-response-stage.label: Total Request Responses Blocked
total-blocked-request-response-stage.description: Total number of blocked callbacks to be executed after a task on a remote node is completed.

total-blocked-mutation-stage.label: Total Write Requests Blocked
total-blocked-mutation-stage.description: Total number of write requests received by the cluster and blocked waiting to be handled.

total-blocked-counter-mutation-stage.label: Counter Mutation Requests Total Blocked
total-blocked-counter-mutation-stage.description: Total number of counter mutation requests received by the cluster that are blocked and waiting to be handled.

total-blocked-native-transport-requests.label: Total Native Transport Requests Requests Blocked
total-blocked-native-transport-requests.description: Total Native Transport Requests Requests Blocked

all-pending.label: Task Queues
all-pending.description: Aggregate of thread pools pending queues that can be used to identify where things are backing up internally. This doesn't include pending compactions because it includes an estimate outside of the task queue or the hinted hand off queue, which can be in constant state of being on.

all-dropped.label: Dropped Tasks
all-dropped.description: Aggregate of different messages that might be thrown away.

dropped-counter-mutations.label: Dropped Counter Mutations
dropped-counter-mutations.description: Mutation was seen after the timeout (write_request_timeout_in_ms) so was thrown away. This client might have timed out before it met the required consistency level, but might have succeeded as well. Hinted handoffs and read repairs should resolve inconsistencies but a repair can ensure it.

dropped-mutations.label: Dropped Mutations
dropped-mutations.description: Mutation was seen after the timeout (write_request_timeout_in_ms) so was thrown away. This client might have timed out before it met the required consistency level, but might have succeeded as well. Hinted handoffs and read repairs should resolve inconsistencies but a repair can ensure it.

dropped-reads.label: Dropped Reads
dropped-reads.description: A local read request was received after the timeout (read_request_timeout_in_ms) so it was thrown away because it would have already either been completed and sent to client or sent back as a timeout error.

dropped-ranged-slice-reads.label: Dropped Ranged Slice Reads
dropped-ranged-slice-reads.description: A local ranged read request was received after the timeout (range_request_timeout_in_ms) so it was thrown away because it would have already either been completed and sent to client or sent back as a timeout error.

dropped-paged-range-reads.label: Dropped Paged Range Reads
dropped-paged-range-reads.description: A local paged read request was received after the timeout (request_timeout_in_ms) so it was thrown away because it would have already either been completed and sent to client or sent back as a timeout error.

dropped-request-responses.label: Dropped Request Responses
dropped-request-responses.description: A response to a request was received after the timeout (request_timeout_in_ms) so it was thrown away because it would have already either been completed and sent to client or sent back as a timeout error.

dropped-read-repairs.label: Dropped Read Repairs
dropped-read-repairs.description: The Mutation was seen after the timeout (write_request_timeout_in_ms) so was thrown away. With the read repair timeout, the node still exists in an inconsistent state.

key-cache-hits.label: KeyCache Hits
key-cache-hits.description: The number of key cache hits per second. This will avoid possible disk seeks when finding a partition in an SSTable.

key-cache-requests.label: KeyCache Requests
key-cache-requests.description: The number of key cache requests per second.

key-cache-hit-rate.label: KeyCache Hit Rate
key-cache-hit-rate.description: The percentage of key cache lookups that resulted in a hit.

row-cache-hits.label: RowCache Hits
row-cache-hits.description: The number of row cache hits per second.

row-cache-requests.label: RowCache Requests
row-cache-requests.description: The number of row cache requests per second.

row-cache-hit-rate.label: RowCache Hit Rate
row-cache-hit-rate.description: The percentage of row cache lookups that resulted in a hit.

native-connections.label: Native Clients
native-connections.description: The number of clients connected using the native protocol.

thrift-connections.label: Thrift Clients
thrift-connections.description: The number of clients connected via thrift.

read-repair-attempted.label: Read Repairs Attempted
read-repair-attempted.description: Number of read requests where the number of nodes queried possibly exceeds the consistency level requested in order to check for a possible digest mismatch.

read-repaired-background.label: Asynchronous Read Repairs
read-repaired-background.description: Corresponds to a digest mismatch that occurred after a completed read, outside of the client read loop.

read-repaired-blocking.label: Synchronous Read Repairs
read-repaired-blocking.description: Corresponds to the number of times there was a digest mismatch within the requested consistency level and a full data read was started.

cf-write-ops.label: TBL: Local Writes
cf-write-ops.description: Local write requests per second. Local writes update the table's memtable and appends to a commitlog.

cf-write-latency-op.label: TBL: Local Write Latency
cf-write-latency-op.description: Average response time to write data to a table's memtable and append to the commitlog. The elapsed time from when the replica receives the request from a coordinator and returns a response.

cf-local-write-latency.label: TBL: Write Latency (Stacked)
cf-local-write-latency.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentile of the response times to write data to a table's memtable and append to the commitlog. The elapsed time from when the replica receives the request from a coordinator and returns a response.

cf-read-ops.label: TBL: Local Reads
cf-read-ops.description: Local read requests per second. Local reads retrieve data from a table's memtable and any necessary SSTables on disk.

cf-read-latency-op.label: TBL: Local Read Latency
cf-read-latency-op.description: Average response time to read data from the memtable and SSTables for a specific table. The elapsed time from when the replica receives the request from a coordinator and returns a response.

cf-local-read-latency.label: TBL: Read Latency (Stacked)
cf-local-read-latency.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentile of the response time to read data from the memtable and sstables for a specific table. The elapsed time from when the replica receives the request from a coordinator and returns a response.

cf-live-disk-used.label: TBL: Live Disk Used
cf-live-disk-used.description: Disk space used by live SSTables. There might be obsolete SSTables not included.

cf-total-disk-used.label: TBL: Total Disk Used
cf-total-disk-used.description: Disk space used by a table by SSTables, including obsolete ones waiting to be garbage collected.

cf-live-sstables.label: TBL: SSTable Count
cf-live-sstables.description: Total number of SSTables for a table.

cf-sstables-per-read.label: TBL: SSTables per Read (Stacked)
cf-sstables-per-read.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentile of how many SSTables are accessed during a read. Includes sstables that undergo bloom-filter checks, even if no data is read from the sstable.
cf-sstables-per-read.p99th: 99th - 99 percent of reads checked or read no more than this many SSTables during the period.
cf-sstables-per-read.p90th: 90th - 90 percent of reads checked or read no more than this many SSTables during the period.
cf-sstables-per-read.median: Median - 50 percent of reads checked or read no more than this many SSTables during the period.
cf-sstables-per-read.max: Max - Maximum number of SSTables checked or read during this period for a single read on this table.
cf-sstables-per-read.min: Min - Minimum number of SSTables checked or read during this period for a single read on this table.

cf-column-count.label: CF: Cell Count
cf-column-count.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentile of how many cells exist in partitions for this table.
cf-column-count.p99th: 99th - 99 percent of partitions have no more than this many cells.
cf-column-count.p90th: 90th - 90 percent of partitions have no more than this many cells.
cf-column-count.median: Median - 50 percent of partitions have no more than this many cells.
cf-column-count.max: Max - Maximum number of cells in a partition.
cf-column-count.min: Min - Minimum number of cells in a partition.

cf-partition-size.label: CF: Partition Size
cf-partition-size.description: The min, median, max, 90th, and 99th percentile of the size (in bytes) of partitions of this table.
cf-partition-size.p99th: 99th - 99 percent of partitions are no larger than this.
cf-partition-size.p90th: 90th - 90 percent of partitions are no larger than this.
cf-partition-size.median: Median - 50 percent of partitions are no larger than this.
cf-partition-size.max: Max - Maximum size of a partition in bytes.
cf-partition-size.min: Min - Minimum size of a partition in bytes

cf-pending-tasks.label: TBL: Pending Reads/Writes
cf-pending-tasks.description: Estimate of the number of mutation threads blocked on a memtable flush or truncate.

cf-bf-space-used.label: TBL: Bloom Filter Space Used
cf-bf-space-used.description: The total size of all the SSTables' bloom filters for this table.

cf-bf-false-positives.label: TBL: Bloom Filter False Positives
cf-bf-false-positives.description: Number of bloom filter false positives per second.

cf-bf-false-ratio.label: TBL: Bloom Filter False Positive Ratio
cf-bf-false-ratio.description: Percentage of bloom filter lookups that resulted in a false positive.

cf-bf-offheap.label: TBL: Bloom Filter Off Heap
cf-bf-offheap.description: Total off heap memory used by bloom filters from all live SSTables in a table.

cf-index-summary-offheap.label: TBL: Index Summary Off Heap
cf-index-summary-offheap.description: Total off heap memory used by the index summary of all live SSTables in a table.

cf-compression-data-offheap.label: TBL: Compression Metadata Off Heap
cf-compression-data-offheap.description: Total off heap memory used by the compression metadata of all live SSTables in a table.

cf-memtable-offheap.label: TBL: Memtable Off Heap
cf-memtable-offheap.description: Off heap memory used by a table's current memtable.

cf-all-memtables-datasize.label: TBL: Total Memtable Size
cf-all-memtables-datasize.description: An estimate of the space used in memory (including JVM overhead) for all memtables. This includes ones that are currently being flushed and related secondary indexes.

cf-all-memtables-heapsize.label: TBL: Total Memtable Heap Size
cf-all-memtables-heapsize.description: An estimate of the space used in JVM heap memory for all memtables. This includes ones that are currently being flushed and related secondary indexes.

cf-all-memtables-livedatasize.label: TBL: Total Memtable Live Data Size
cf-all-memtables-livedatasize.description: An estimate of the space used for 'live data' (off-heap, excluding overhead) for all memtables. This includes ones that are currently being flushed and related secondary indexes.

cf-all-memtables-offheapsize.label: TBL: Total Memtable Off-Heap Size
cf-all-memtables-offheapsize.description: An estimate of the space used in off-heap memory for all memtables. This includes ones that are currently being flushed and related secondary indexes.

solr-requests.label: Search: Requests
solr-requests.description: Requests per second made to a specific Solr core/index.

solr-avg-time-per-req.label: Search: Request Latency
solr-avg-time-per-req.description: Average time a search query takes in a DSE cluster using DSE Search.

solr-errors.label: Search: Errors
solr-errors.description: Errors per second that occur for a specific Solr core/index.

solr-timeouts.label: Search: Timeouts
solr-timeouts.description: Timeouts per second on a specific Solr core/index.

solr-index-size.label: Search: Core Size
solr-index-size.description: Size of the Solr core on disk.

in-memory-percent-used.label: In-Memory Percent Used
in-memory-percent-used.description: The percentage of memory allocated for in-memory tables currently in use.

os-memory.label: OS: Memory (stacked)
os-memory.description: Stacked graph of used, cached, and free memory.

os-memory-osx.label: OS: Memory (stacked)
os-memory-osx.description: Stacked graph of used and free memory.

os-memory-win.label: OS: Memory (stacked)
os-memory-win.description: Stacked graph of committed, cached, paged, non-paged, and free memory.

os-memory-shared.label: OS: Memory Shared
os-memory-shared.description: Total amount of memory in shared memory space.

os-memory-committed.label: OS: Memory Committed
os-memory-committed.description: Memory in use by the operating system.

os-memory-sys-cache-resident.label: OS: System Cache Resident Memory
os-memory-sys-cache-resident.description: Memory used by the file cache.

cpu.label: OS: CPU (stacked)
cpu.description: Stacked graph of iowait, steal, nice, system, user, and idle CPU usage.

cpu-osx.label: OS: CPU (stacked)
cpu-osx.description: Stacked graph of idle, user, and system CPU usage.

cpu-win.label: OS: CPU (stacked)
cpu-win.description: Stacked graph of user, privileged, and idle CPU usage.

os-cpu-user.label: OS: CPU User
os-cpu-user.description: Time the CPU devotes to user processes.

os-cpu-system.label: OS: CPU System
os-cpu-system.description: Time the CPU devotes to system processes.

os-cpu-iowait.label: OS: CPU Iowait
os-cpu-iowait.description: Time the CPU devotes to waiting for I/O to complete.

os-cpu-steal.label: OS: CPU Steal
os-cpu-steal.description: Time the CPU devotes to tasks stolen by virtual operating systems.

os-cpu-nice.label: OS: CPU Nice
os-cpu-nice.description: Time the CPU devotes to processing nice tasks.

os-cpu-privileged.label: OS: CPU Privileged
os-cpu-privileged.description: Time the CPU devotes to processing privileged instructions.

os-disk-usage.label: OS: Disk Usage (%)
os-disk-usage.description: Disk space used by Cassandra at a given time.
os-disk-usage.total: Total - The sum of all the nodes disk used values divided by the sum of all the nodes total disk space.

os-disk-free.label: OS: Disk Free
os-disk-free.description: Free space on a specific disk partition.

os-disk-used.label: OS: Disk Used
os-disk-used.description: Disk space used by Cassandra at a given time.

os-disk-read-throughput.label: OS: Disk Read Throughput
os-disk-read-throughput.description: Average disk throughput for read operations.

os-disk-write-throughput.label: OS: Disk Write Throughput
os-disk-write-throughput.description: Average disk throughput for write operations.

os-disk-throughput.label: OS: Disk Throughput
os-disk-throughput.description: Average disk throughput for read and write operations.

os-disk-read-rate.label: OS: Disk Read Rate
os-disk-read-rate.description: Rate of reads per second to the disk.

os-disk-write-rate.label: OS: Disk Writes Rate
os-disk-write-rate.description: Rate of writes per second to the disk.

os-disk-await.label: OS: Disk Latency
os-disk-await.description: Average completion time of each request to the disk.

os-disk-request-size.label: OS: Disk Request Size
os-disk-request-size.description: Average size of read requests issued to the disk.

os-disk-request-size-kb.label: OS: Disk Request Size
os-disk-request-size-kb.description: Average size of read requests issued to the disk.

os-disk-queue-size.label: OS: Disk Queue Size
os-disk-queue-size.description: Average number of requests queued due to disk latency issues.

os-disk-utilization.label: OS: Disk Utilization
os-disk-utilization.description: CPU time consumed by disk I/O.

os-net-received.label: OS: Net Received
os-net-received.description: Speed of data received from the network.

os-net-sent.label: OS: Net Sent
os-net-sent.description: Speed of data sent across the network.
